definition: a long cannon (such as an 18-pounder) of the 16th and 17th centuries
a yellowish-brown to dark brown pigment used in art
a disease (such as scurvy) caused by a lack of essential dietary elements and especially a vitamin or mineral
causing someone to feel sad, unhappy, or displeased because something was not as good as expected or because something hoped for or expected did not happen
orderly movement through a circuit; especially : the movement of blood through the vessels of the body induced by the pumping action of the heart
of, relating to, or resembling paradise
a loose overcoat with raglan sleeves
